## useWatch() function

Custom hook to subscribe to field change and isolate re-rendering at the component level.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function useWatch<TFieldValues extends FieldValues = FieldValues, TFieldNames extends readonly FieldPath<TFieldValues>[] = readonly FieldPath<TFieldValues>[]>(props: {
    name: readonly [...TFieldNames];
    defaultValue?: DeepPartialSkipArrayKey<TFieldValues>;
    control?: Control<TFieldValues>;
    disabled?: boolean;
    exact?: boolean;
}): FieldPathValues<TFieldValues, TFieldNames>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  props | { name: readonly \[...TFieldNames\]; defaultValue?: [DeepPartialSkipArrayKey](./react-hook-form.deeppartialskiparraykey.md)<!-- -->&lt;TFieldValues&gt;; control?: [Control](./react-hook-form.control.md)<!-- -->&lt;TFieldValues&gt;; disabled?: boolean; exact?: boolean; } | defaultValue, disable subscription and match exact name. |

**Returns:**

[FieldPathValues](./react-hook-form.fieldpathvalues.md)<!-- -->&lt;TFieldValues, TFieldNames&gt;

## Remarks

\[API\](https://react-hook-form.com/docs/usewatch) â€¢ \[Demo\](https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-v7-ts-usewatch-h9i5e)

## Example


```tsx
const { watch } = useForm();
const values = useWatch({
  control,
  name: ["fieldA", "fieldB"],
  defaultValue: {
    fieldA: "data",
    fieldB: "data"
  },
  exact: false,
})
```
